DataElement.preferredName: Cervical Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Distant Metastasis M Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for cervical carcinoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to pathologic M stage of a cervical tumor (or cancer of the uterine cervix).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to a neck, or cervix, in any sense.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: Relating to a neck, or cervix, in any sense.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/10/17 tt Transferred ownership/BC and changed Reg Status.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Cervical Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 M Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of cervical cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pM1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pM1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical cancer with distant metastasis (including peritoneal spread or involvement of the supraclavicular, mediastinal, or distant lymph nodes; lung; liver; or bone). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pM1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cervical cancer with distant metastasis (including peritoneal spread or involvement of the supraclavicular, mediastinal, or distant lymph nodes; lung; liver; or bone). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical cancer in which there is no evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cervical cancer in which there is no evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
